That the very wicked should possess great wealth or good fortune is not on the whole displeasing to the less favoured temnant—for there is in men so firm a persuasion of justice that they enjoy with hardly a question, as a present pleasure to themselves, that miserable hereafter which they confidently anticipate for others.
